description: Returns a set of temporary security credentials that you can use to access AWS resources.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: By assuming a role with higher privileges, an attacker could disable or remove access for legitimate users, making it harder for defenders to detect and respond.
The attacker can create or manipulate roles and policies to generate additional credentials, enabling unauthorized access or persistent control over resources.
If the assumed role has sufficient privileges, an attacker can modify IAM policies or roles, potentially allowing them to grant themselves or others additional permissions.
An attacker with an assumed role could disable or modify logging or security tools, reducing the ability of defenders to detect ongoing attacks.
The attacker can leverage the temporary credentials obtained through AssumeRole to access services in different accounts, enabling lateral movement across AWS environments.

researchLinks.description: Detecting and removing risky actions out of your IAM security policies

securityImplications: Attackers might use AssumeRole to gain unauthorized access to an AWS role. This might allow them to gain initial access, escalate privileges or in specific scenarios gain persistence.
